Third COP Workshop - Incentives and Obstacles to Communicating Progress

Palais des Nations, Geneva, 2 -3 April 2007

The Global Compact office organizes an annual expert meeting on Communication on Progress (COP) to inform about the current status of COP and to get input and practical recommendations for its future work. This years meeting brought together 30+ experts from Global Compact participants, country networks, standard and service organizations, investors, academia and the Global Compact office. The meeting was moderated by Claude Fussler, Senior Advisor to the Global Compact. The overall question of the meeting was twofold: How can the large number of “inactive participants (participants that do not report)” be reduced, and how can the quality of the COPs of the reporting companies be further improved? The two day workshop consisted of presentations and discussions. The agenda, including a list of participants can be downloaded by clicking here . Each of the presentations can be downloaded by clicking the name of the presenter below.

First Findings: The Value of Communicating Progress Project

The Future of Reporting: Defining context and how COPs can be integrated into existing management and reporting systems

Incentives and Obstacles: Why some communicate

Incentives and Obstacles: Why others do not
  • Open discussion led by Flavio Fuertes, Global Compact - Argentina

Open Issues

  • Benchmarking? – Fritz Brugger, Guilé Engagement Team
  • Principles of Excellence in Reporting? – Alan Knight, AccountAbility
  • Peer Review - Tara Hopkins, Rio Tinto
  • Annual reporting for bi-annual reporters? – Lisa Huggins-Chan, Cadbury Schweppes
  • Headquarters and Subsidiaries; How to implement and report? – Angel Fraile, ENDESA

What can we do foster continual improvement for those who are communicating and help those who are not? Presentation by Jeff Senne and open discussion led by Oliver Johner, COP Analyst, Global Compact Office.
